studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Clarified US-specific definition of clinical remission and its application to the analysis population.
Added Bristol Stool Form Scale (BSFS) as a new exploratory data collection tool.

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Table 1, footnote h; Table 2, footnote k; Table 3, footnote m; Attachment 4
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Modified TB skin testing requirements specifically for study centers in Ukraine.

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: 2.1.2.2, Secondary Objectives; 9.2.2.2.2, Major Secondary Endpoints; 11.2.2, Table 7
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Reordered maintenance study secondary objectives and updated the analysis population for corticosteroid-free remission.
Clarified unblinding procedures for futility analysis and database locks.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: To address health authority requests for additional data collection and provide further clarifications.
To address investigator feedback regarding protocol implementation.
Health authority requested collection of stool consistency data using the Bristol Stool Form Scale.
Tuberculin unavailability in Ukraine necessitated a change in TB testing requirements.
Update to reflect availability of highly effective antiviral therapy for Hepatitis C clearance.

studyChanges.beforeText: Not explicitly stated as US-specific in previous version
studyChanges.afterText: The following US-specific definition of clinical remission will be used in the United States: an absolute stool number ≤3, a rectal bleeding subscore of 0, and a Mayo endoscopy subscore of 0 or 1.
studyChanges.summary: Defined US-specific clinical remission criteria for regulatory submission.

studyChanges.afterText: To evaluate the data based on the Bristol Stool Form Scale score in the induction study.
studyChanges.summary: Added exploratory objective for Bristol Stool Form Scale.
Added International System of Units (SI) equivalents to screening laboratory parameters.

studyChanges.beforeText: Seropositive for antibodies to hepatitis C virus (HCV)
studyChanges.afterText: Are seropositive for antibodies to hepatitis C virus (HCV) without a history of successful treatment, defined as being negative for HCV RNA at least 24 weeks after completing antiviral treatment.
studyChanges.summary: Updated HCV exclusion to allow subjects clinically cured of Hepatitis C.

studyChanges.afterText: If receiving budesonide or beclomethasone dipropionate
studyChanges.summary: Included beclomethasone dipropionate as an allowed corticosteroid formulation.
Clarified that a full colonoscopy is required for subjects at risk of polyps or dysplasia.
